A4.text: Trumbull was elected to the Senate as the choice of the antiâ€‘slavery faction of the Illinois legislature, defeating Abraham Lincoln.

A5.text: When he entered the Senate in December 1855, Trumbull's credentials were challenged by Senator Lewis Cass of Michigan.

A6.text: He served in the General Assembly and represented the 7th congressional district in the U.S. House of Representatives before his election to the presidency in 1860.
